item.title: What Time Does Black Ops 7 Launch? Release Times & Timezones Explained
item.content:encoded:
In Call of Duty: Black Ops 7, you have the next CoD game, but also the continuation of the Black Ops saga. It allows Treyarch to flex its muscles once more, and if you can’t wait to play Black Ops 7, knowing its launch times is the perfect weapon.

Between a plethora of Zombies content, Black Ops 7’s fascinating endgame content, and the usual year-long multiplayer madness, you’ve got a lot to keep you busy in BLOPS 7. The title neatly wraps up this mini-chapter in Call of Duty history, which can lead to a nice break for Treyarch as it works on its next entry.

For now, let’s enjoy Black Ops 7 and find out its launch times.

When Is Black Ops 7 Live?

Black Ops 7 first goes live at 9:00 PM PST on November 13.

Whereas November 14 is considered the default release date for Black Ops 7, a small handful of areas technically get access on November 13—lucky you!

We know many of the launch times for key regions around the world. To make this easier, here’s a complete list showing you each highlighted region and what time and date Black Ops 7 is available there.

Can You Play Black Ops 7 Early?

Unfortunately, there is no early access for the Campaign, Zombies, or Multiplayer this year in Black Ops 7.

There’s not much to add. There was initial speculation that the Black Ops 7 Campaign and Zombies were set to release four days early. However, while Activision didn’t address the speculation directly, the company covered the rumor by stating Black Ops 7 doesn’t have early access—breaking all of our hearts in the process.

Still, there are only a few days to go now. As long as you have your referenced timezone on hand, you should know when the new Call of Duty goes live in your digital storefront. Furthermore, for more help on this, we also have an in-depth Black Ops 7 preload guide, showing you how to set this up and enable you to play the second Black Ops 7 drops!

It also covers the game’s excessive file sizes across all formats. We hope this and our other CoD guides are answering your biggest questions about the latest CoD release. If you have more questions, we encourage you to check out the Insider Gaming Discord Server.

Make sure you check out the Complete Call of Duty: Black Ops 7 Trophy List, every Scorestreak, and the game’s Final PC Specs.

item.title: Complete Call Of Duty: Black Ops 7 Trophy List—How to Get All Achievements And Trophies
item.content:encoded:
Call of Duty: Black Ops 7 is finally here, and, as always, there’s a long list of unique trophies and achievements for players to earn. To help you with what you need, Insider Gaming has the complete list for you to check out.

Developer by Treyarch and Raven Software, Call of Duty: Black Ops 7 is the follow up to last year’s Black Ops 6, but acts as a sequel to the events of Black Ops 2. The game will be available on both current- and last-gen platforms aside from the Nintendo Switch and Switch 2.

Its trophy list looks fun, so let’s check out the full list of achievements.

All Call Of Duty: Black Ops 7 Trophies & Acheivements

As with most trophy lists, there are likely to be spoilers from the game’s campaign and other areas. So, consider this your only warning. To earn every achievement, you’ll need to

In total there are 50 trophies to collect with a mix Gold, Silver, and Bronze.

How Many Bronze Trophies In Black Ops 7?

There’s a total of 38 bronze trophies and achievements in Black Ops 7, all of which are listed below.

How Many Silver Trophies In Black Ops 7?

There’s a total of 10 silver trophies and achievements in Black Ops 7. You can find them below.

How Many Gold Trophies In Black Ops 7?

There’s are two gold trophies and achievements in Black Ops 7, which you can see below:

Is There A Platinum Trophy?

Because of the way Activision handles things with the Call of Duty HQ app, there is once again no Platinum Trophy for Black Ops 7.

How Many Trophies Are In Black Ops 7?

In total, there are 50 trophies for Black Ops 7. If you are looking for a full breakdown of rarity, there are 38 bronze, 10 silver, and two gold to earn. When it comes to modes, Zombies has 17 achievements, Multiplayer has 14, the Campaign as 13, and there are five Global achievements. For some it may be too long while others might not find it long enough. Either way, there’s still plenty to do for you achievement hunters out there every time to boot up the game.

For more Insider Gaming and Call of Duty: Black Ops 7, check out the full list of launch weapons and equipment. And don’t forget to join the official Insider Gaming Discord server.

item.title: Call Of Duty App Update On PS5 Requires You To Reinstall Black Ops 6 And Warzone
item.content:encoded:
Activision is getting ready to launch Call of Duty: Black Ops 7 on November 14. With that preparation comes an update to the Call of Duty app on various platforms, and one platform needing the update is PlayStation 5 (PS5).

The Call of Duty HQ app on PS5 requires around 100GB to install. This update includes Multiplayer and Zombies while a separate Campaign pack is needed for that section of the game. And while that should be it to get ready to playing Black Ops 7, if you still want to play either Black Ops 6 or Warzone, you’re going to have to do more after the updating the HQ app.

After the new update, you’re going to be required to reinstall both the Black Ops 6 and Warzone packs if you want to keep playing those games and their modes. It’s an extra step and more time to play the games that were already previously installed. And, because the app update is mandatory for everyone, there’s seemingly no way around it on PS5.

Are you going to reinstall Warzone or Black Ops 6 to keep playing on your PS5 after the Call of Duty app update, or are you just going to wait now for Black Ops 7? Leave your thoughts down in the comments and join the official Insider Gaming Discord server.

For more Insider Gaming, read about what Bethesda’s Todd Howard had to say about when players should expect The Elder Scrolls 6. And don’t forget to sign up for our weekly newsletter.
